data.text:
Manasa Special School, Shankarpura a with the long vison of Rev. Fr. J.P Tauro

(1992)

The Catholic Sabha Mangalore Pradesh (R) a lay peoples Organisation was started in the Year 1979 with Sri Oscar Fernandes M. P. of Udupi, as a its founder President. This is an Official Social Organisation of the Diocese of Mangalore.

The Decennial celebration held in the Year 1989 provided its members the much needed booster dose to expand.

The growth and the need based activities and programs of Catholic Sabha, Mr. Agustine Gomes then Vice Pesident of Shirva Varado, came forward to offer as a donation one acre of his land to the Sabha to start some special project.

Manasa Special School, Shankarpura a with the long vison of Rev. Fr. J.P Tauro

(1992)

As result of a survey conducted in and around the parishes of Shirva Varada it was found that there were over a hundred mentally challenged children to be trained and rehabilitated within this limited area.

Immediately, the Catholic Sabha took up the project of a Teaching and training School for such children in Pangala Parish Shankerapura Campus on 11.08.1991. Dr. Edward Lobo was made the Convener of that School. On 12.12.1992 the second School was opened in Shirva Parish Campus by the initiative of Mr. Augustine Gomes.

Late Bishop Rev. Dr. Basil D'Souza laying the foundation stone for Manasa

(16.06.1995)

By the year 1995, it was realised that a Teaching School, is not sufficient to train these children. Therefore Training and a Rehabilitation Center had to be planned.

Due to certain legal hurdles, the land offered by Mr. Augustine Gomes had to be dropped. Simultaneously, a plot of two acres of Government Land near Pamboor Church was acquired Mr. Augustine Gomes paid Rs. 50,000/- towards the cost and initial developing of the cost.

Dâ Souza on 14.11.1997 But the centre had started working at the new promises on 01.06.1997 taking the children of the two schools at Pangala and Shirva and at the same time the two schools were closed.

Inauguration of Manasa

(14.11.1997)

he Year 1995 , on 28th day of March 1995 when Dr. Gerald Pinto was the president of Catholic Sabha. Mangalore Pradesh. (R) a separate trust Consisting of 15 trustees was registered, four of them being ex- Official members and the remaining 11 as Life time Trustees .
